Bardock also appeared as murder suspect Scott Burnett in ''[[The Bill]]'' in 2004. His character was developed and he began a relationship with P.C Honey Harman and later married her though the marriage was short lived after it was discovered that he had murdered his first wife. His character later died in prison having hanged himself. He also appeared in ''[[Sixty Six (film)|Sixty-Six]]'' as the sadistic pornographer, Jason Reynolds as well as the [[Channel 4]] series ''[[No Angels (TV series)|No Angels]]'', in which he played registrar Peter Compton. Bardock had a small part in [[ITV Network|ITV]]'s ''[[Midsomer Murders]]'' and in May 2005, Bardock played DI Tom Wilson in ''[[New Tricks]]''.
 
Bardock also appeared as murder suspect Scott Burnett in ''[[The Bill]]'' in 2004. His character was developed and he began a relationship with P.C Honey Harman and later married her though the marriage was short lived after it was discovered that he had murdered his first wife. His character later died in prison having hanged himself. He also appeared in ''[[Sixty Six (film)|Sixty-Six]]'' as the sadistic pornographer, Jason Reynolds as well as the [[Channel 4]] series ''[[No Angels (TV series)|No Angels]]'', in which he played registrar Peter Compton. Bardock had a small part in [[ITV Network|ITV]]'s ''[[Midsomer Murders]]'' and in May 2005, Bardock played DI Tom Wilson in ''[[New Tricks]]''.
    −
Bardock joined the [[BBC]] television series ''[[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]'' as paramedic [[Characters of Casualty#Jeff Collier|Jeff Collier]] in February 2007 for three months, before returning to the programme in September of that year. On 30 June 2014, it was announced that Bardock would be leaving his role as Jeff and that Jeff will die in late 2014.<ref name=Casualtyexit>http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s18/casualty/news/a581153/casualty-matt-bardock-leaving-jeff-collier-role.html#~oIGc7HTOzz8den</ref>
+
Bardock re-joined the [[BBC]] television series ''[[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]'' as paramedic [[Characters of Casualty#Jeff Collier|Jeff Collier]] in February 2007 for three months, before returning to the programme in September of that year. On 30 June 2014, it was announced that Bardock would be leaving his role as Jeff and that Jeff will die in late 2014.<ref name=Casualtyexit>http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s18/casualty/news/a581153/casualty-matt-bardock-leaving-jeff-collier-role.html#~oIGc7HTOzz8den</ref>
     
In 2008 Bardock turned on the Christmas lights in [[Newbury, Berkshire]]. He flicked the switch at 5:00pm on Friday 28 November in The Market Place.<ref>Johnson, Ben, [http://www.newburytoday.co.uk/News/Article.aspx?articleID=8645 "Casualty star switches on Newbury Christmas lights in front of thousand-strong Market Place audience"] ''NewburyToday.co.uk'', 29 November 2008</ref>
 
In 2008 Bardock turned on the Christmas lights in [[Newbury, Berkshire]]. He flicked the switch at 5:00pm on Friday 28 November in The Market Place.<ref>Johnson, Ben, [http://www.newburytoday.co.uk/News/Article.aspx?articleID=8645 "Casualty star switches on Newbury Christmas lights in front of thousand-strong Market Place audience"] ''NewburyToday.co.uk'', 29 November 2008</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}} {{BLP sources|date=September 2010}} '''Matthew Arthur "Matt" Bardock''' (born 5 April 1969) in Coulsdon, Surrey is an English actor. ==Early life== Bardock attended [[Woodcote High School]] in [[Coulsdon]], Surrey, where he was a drummer, and was a member of the [[National Youth Theatre of Great Britain]] before training at the [[Guildhall School of Music and Drama]]. ==Career== Bardock made his television debut in 1992, when he appeared in ''[[Prime Suspect]]'' and the following year, he appeared in [[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]] as a leading gang member that set fire to the ED. In 1995, Bardock appeared in the stage production of 'Mojo' by [[Jez Butterworth]] at the [[Royal Court Theatre]]. Bardock came to notice for his role as D.C. Clive Barnard in the British television series ''[[A Touch of Frost]]''. Bardock's character, Barnard, was the nephew of the [[Chief Constable]]. While many believe he had only got into [[Criminal Investigation Department|CID]] through his family connections, Frost sees beyond that and takes Barnard under his wing. He was later promoted to Detective Sergeant, but was killed off in the 1997 episode "No Other Love." July and August 2000 saw Bardock played the role of Danny Weir in the short-lived TV comedy ''[[Pay And Display (TV series)|Pay and Display]]''. Bardock also appeared as murder suspect Scott Burnett in ''[[The Bill]]'' in 2004. His character was developed and he began a relationship with P.C Honey Harman and later married her though the marriage was short lived after it was discovered that he had murdered his first wife. His character later died in prison having hanged himself. He also appeared in ''[[Sixty Six (film)|Sixty-Six]]'' as the sadistic pornographer, Jason Reynolds as well as the [[Channel 4]] series ''[[No Angels (TV series)|No Angels]]'', in which he played registrar Peter Compton. Bardock had a small part in [[ITV Network|ITV]]'s ''[[Midsomer Murders]]'' and in May 2005, Bardock played DI Tom Wilson in ''[[New Tricks]]''. Bardock re-joined the [[BBC]] television series ''[[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]'' as paramedic [[Characters of Casualty#Jeff Collier|Jeff Collier]] in February 2007 for three months, before returning to the programme in September of that year. On 30 June 2014, it was announced that Bardock would be leaving his role as Jeff and that Jeff will die in late 2014.http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s18/casualty/news/a581153/casualty-matt-bardock-leaving-jeff-collier-role.html#~oIGc7HTOzz8den In 2008 Bardock turned on the Christmas lights in [[Newbury, Berkshire]]. He flicked the switch at 5:00pm on Friday 28 November in The Market Place.Johnson, Ben, [http://www.newburytoday.co.uk/News/Article.aspx?articleID=8645 "Casualty star switches on Newbury Christmas lights in front of thousand-strong Market Place audience"] ''NewburyToday.co.uk'', 29 November 2008 Between 31 July and 27 September 2014, he will be appearing in comedy play My Night With Reg at the Donmar Warehouse theatre in the West End. ==Notable roles== ===Film=== *''[[All or Nothing (film)|All or Nothing]]'' (2002) … Man at Bar (director: Mike Leigh) *''Bollywood Queen'' (2001) … Facer (director: Jeremy Wooding) {| class=wikitable cellspacing=''6''cellspacing="0" style="empty-cells: show; border-collapse: collapse" !style="background:#efefef;"|Year !style="background:#efefef;"|Film !style="background:#efefef;"|Role !style="background:#efefef;"|Director !style="background:#efefef;"|Notes |- |1999|| ''[[Topsy-Turvy]]'' || Mr Benjamin Trip || [[Mike Leigh]] || |- | 1999 || ''[[This Year's Love]]'' || David
Billy's mate || [[David Kane]] || |- | 2000 || ''[[Honest (film)|Honest]]'' || Cedric || Paul Weiland || |- | 2001 || ''Jimmy Fizz'' || Drew || [[Tony Maylam]] || |- |2006||''[[Sixty Six (film)|Sixty Six]]''||Mr Grieg||[[Paul Weiland]]|| |- |2007||''[[Cassandra's Dream]]''||Finn

Ian Winfarthing in [[List of Kavanagh QC episodes#Series 4|"Innocency of Life"]]; 14 April 1998(director: Ferdy Fairfax) *''[[The Lakes (TV series)|The Lakes]]'' … Albie; 1997 (director: David Blair) *''[[The History of Tom Jones, a Foundling#Film, TV, operas, and theatrical adaptations|Tom Jones]]'' … Jack; 1997 (director: Metin Huseyin) *''Deep Secrets'' … Martin; 1996 (director: Diarmiud Lawrence) *''[[Bodyguards]]'' … DI Trevor Curran; 1995 (director: Bob Bierman) *''[[The Adventures of Young Indiana Jones]]'' … Carl in [[List of The Young Indiana Jones Chronicles episodes#Season III (1994–96)|"Attack of the Hawkmen"]]; 8 October 1995 (director: Ben Burtt) *''[[A Touch of Frost]]'' … DC Barnard; 1992 *''[[Prime Suspect]]'' … Jason; 1992 (director: John Strickland) ===Theatre=== *''[[The Dark (play)|The Dark]]'' … Barnaby; [[Donmar Warehouse]], London; 23 March – 24 April 2004 (director: Anna Mackmin) *''Frame 312'' … Tom and Roy; Donmar Warehouse, London; 2002 (director: Josie Rourke) *''Kick For Touch'' … Joe; Crucible Theatre, London; 2002 (director: Josie Rourke) ==References and notes== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb name|id=0054304|name=Matt Bardock}} *[http://www.spotlight.com/interactive/cv/1/a828/M887.html Matt Bardock] — CV on Spotlight *[http://www.hattonmcewan.com/actors/actors/925086 HattonMcEwan.com] — profile on agent's website {{Authority control|VIAF=91183695}} {{Persondata | NAME =Bardock, Matt | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = British actor | DATE OF BIRTH = 5 April 1969 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bardock, Matt}} [[Category:English male television actors]] [[Category:English male stage actors]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1969 births]] [[Category:Alumni of the Guildhall School of Music and Drama]]
